OVERWRITE_CLF.title: Overwrite Warning
OVERWRITE_CLF.message: This will delete unsaved classifier and results.

NO_PAIRPLOT_OVERLOAD.title: Pairplot Overload
NO_PAIRPLOT_OVERLOAD.message: Due to software limitations, a pairplot will not be generated.

NO_PAIRPLOT_USELESS.title: Pairplot Size
NO_PAIRPLOT_USELESS.message: Due to the number of variables, a pairplot will not be generated.

NO_COLUMNS_SELECTED.title: No Data Columns Selected
NO_COLUMNS_SELECTED.message: Please select at least one feature column.

PREDICTION_OVERWRITE.title: Overwrite Warning
PREDICTION_OVERWRITE.message: This will delete unsaved prediction results.

ERR_OVERLAP_FEATURES_CLASS.title: Known Class And Feature Columns Overlap
ERR_OVERLAP_FEATURES_CLASS.message: Class column must not be a selected feature column.

SEQUENCE_OVERWRITE.title: Overwrite Warning
SEQUENCE_OVERWRITE.message: You've already loaded custom sequence data. Are you sure?

INVALID_SEQUENCE_DATA.title: Invalid data file
INVALID_SEQUENCE_DATA.message:
Selected data file does not contain required columns.
Please see help document for a list of required columns with exact names.

LOW_CLASS_COUNT.title: Low Classification Count
LOW_CLASS_COUNT.message:
Only {} observations were succesfully classified by online search. This may result in an inaccurate classifier if used for training.
Additional manual classification, if possible, is recommended.

BOLD_NO_OBSERVATIONS.title: No Observations Found
BOLD_NO_OBSERVATIONS.message: No observations were found. Please check your search terms.

MISSING_SEARCH_TERMS.title: Missing Search Term(s)
MISSING_SEARCH_TERMS.message: Please fill in both search terms before requesting data.

NOT_ENOUGH_CLASSES_TO_TRAIN.title: Not Enough Known Classes
NOT_ENOUGH_CLASSES_TO_TRAIN.message:
The data contains fewer than two classes, and cannot be used for training a classifier.
Did you mean to use this data for prediction with a saved classifier?

NOT_ENOUGH_KNOWN_SAMPLES.title: Too Few Known Class Samples
NOT_ENOUGH_KNOWN_SAMPLES.message: The program requires a minimum of 4 known samples per class label. Please provide more known samples. It is recommended to train using significantly more than 4 known samples per label.

NOT_ENOUGH_CLASSES.title: Not Enough Known Classes
NOT_ENOUGH_CLASSES.message:
Automatic status lookup returned fewer than 2 status types (native, introduced).
This data will not be useable for training without manual status entry to ensure a minimum of 2 status types.

ALIGN_MISMATCH.title: Alignment Item Mismatch
ALIGN_MISMATCH.message:
The given alignment contains sequence processid's which are not present in the primary data file.
Please ensure you have selected the correct alignment for the current data.
processids missing:
{}

PID_NOT_UNIQUE.title: Non-Unique ProcessID
PID_NOT_UNIQUE.message:
The processid column of the data contains duplicates.
The UPID column will be generated with suffixes to ensure unique IDs per row.

UPID_NOT_UNIQUE.title: Non-Unique UPID
UPID_NOT_UNIQUE.message:
The UPID column of the data contains duplicates.
If you wish to continue, it will be overwritten with unique values.

HIGH_IMBALANCE.title: High Known Class Imbalance
HIGH_IMBALANCE.message:
The data's known classifications have an extreme imbalance that may result in extreme classifier bias.
It is recommended that more known classifications are added. Train at your own risk.

NAN_TAXON.title: Unknown Taxonomy
NAN_TAXON.message:
The data contains blank entries in the specified Taxonomic Split Level ({}).
This may result in poor feature generation or other unexpected data behavior for those samples.
Proceed?

SINGLE_SPLIT.title: Single-length split
SINGLE_SPLIT.message:
Splitting this data by {} will result in one or more subsets with only one sample.
The program cannot operate on sets of 1. It is recommended that you cancel operation and choose a broader taxonomic level.
If you wish to continue, subsets of 1 will be ignored (no features will be generated for those samples).
Select 'ok' to continue and ignore subsets of 1, or 'cancel' to cancel.

RESERVED_COLUMNS.title: Reserved column names
RESERVED_COLUMNS.message:
The chosen data has one or more columns using names reserved for the Sequence Data Tool (See 'Using the Sequence Data Tool' in the Manual).
Clicking 'Ok' will remove these columns from the data (your original file will not be changed). Clicking 'Cancel' will cancel the operation.
